entry.title: Re: SAM DM Pod execution plugin to do a HTTP POST operati...
entry.content:
Hi,

for sure there could be multiple ways to handle it, like create an iFlow inside SAP IS or do the way your are doing.

But, do it in a different way!

  • we have configured a WebServer named SAPS4 that is configured as it is configured inside SAP Cloud Connector
  • we have attached the SAP BTP destination to call S4 
  • we have created inside Manage Service Registry app our Odata by managing the input and output
  • we call it inside SAP DM PPD, that you can eventually expose and call from your custom plugin.

Let me know if you need support on this!

entry.title: Cross-company contribution margin
entry.content:
Hello,

We want to set up a contribution margin in S/4HANA. Classic way to do this is use the COGS posting during GI and the related revenue posting. The situation is here, that these are two different company codes. Company A manufactures the FG, sells it IC to company code B. Company code B sells the FG to the customer.

Revenue: company code B
COGS: company code A.

Revenue and COGS could happen in different periods, but of course COGS should only be shown if there are revenues. 

Furthermore reporting on actual costs are required, hence actual costing is considered.  There are two main characteristics to consider: profit center and plant of production.

Any solution or advice?

Thank you

entry.title: Unleashing Agentic AI in SAP Sales Cloud V2 : Here is your Invitation to innovate with us!
entry.content:
Agentic AI in SAP Sales Cloud v2: Join the Customer Engagement Initiative

Sales teams are moving faster than ever, and the next leap in productivity comes from agentic AI—intelligent, autonomous assistants that proactively surface insights, take actions, and reduce admin work with guardrails. We’re launching a new SAP Customer Engagement Initiative (CEI) to co-innovate these capabilities with you, our customers.

Our Goal:

Through the CEI, we’ll partner with participating customers to gather hands-on feedback, validate real-world use cases, and refine the agentic innovations planned for SAP Sales Cloud v2. Your input will directly shape product design, usability, and business impact.

What’s in it for participants?

  • Early visibility into prototypes and concepts
  •  Influence on feature priorities and guardrails
  • A direct feedback loop with SAP product and design teams

Planned agents we’re exploring:

  1. Customer Insight Agent: Delivers 360-degree insights for each customer
  2. Deal Manager Agent: Automatically updates opportunities and provides risk insights
  3. Meeting Assist Agent: Summarizes pre- and post-meeting insights and follow-up
  4. Email Scan Agent: Automatically captures leads, quotes, and orders from emails
  5. Order Assist Agent: Enables multi-modal order entry via voice, text, and image
  6. Visit Planning Agent: Automates visit planning and route optimization

Who should join?

Sales leaders, RevOps, Sales Ops, CRM administrators, and IT stakeholders looking to scale efficiency, improve data quality, and unlock guided selling with measurable outcomes.

How to participate ? 

Registration Dates Oct 13, 2025 to Nov 14, 2025

Register at: https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/campaign/4060. 

Help us build agentic experiences that sellers love and leaders trust—join the CEI and shape what’s next in SAP Sales Cloud v2.

We look forward to innovating with you!

The SAP Sales Cloud V2

Product Management Team

entry.title: 🌱 Is the Sustainability Road Map still relevant? Absolutely — and Here’s Why.
entry.content:
Sustainability doesn’t just matter — it empowers our community to implement SAP Sustainability solutions more effectively. Today, sustainability is a strategic priority for every organization, directly influencing long-term profitability, brand reputation, and business resilience.

Recognizing this global movement, we’ve continuously invested in enhancing our SAP Activate for Sustainability Roadmaps — expanding, improving, and updating them to better guide our customers throughout their implementation journeys.

And now, we’re excited to announce a significant evolution:
Instead of one single Sustainability Roadmap, we’ve released three new, dedicated roadmaps, each focused on a specific SAP Sustainability solution area:

  • for EHS environment management and EHS workplace safety.
  • for SAP Sustainability Control Tower.
  • for SAP Sustainability Footprint Management.

These new roadmaps are part of SAP Activate for Sustainability Management, helping you accelerate your Fit-to-Standard preparation and execution with tailored accelerators — designed to make your implementation smoother and more effective.

What’s in it for you?

If you’re implementing any of the Sustainability Management solutions mentioned above, you now have access to two powerful accelerators:

  1. Show and Tell – Ready-to-use materials for interactive Fit-to-Standard sessions, helping business users visualize and understand key solution capabilities.
  2. Fit-to-Standard Questionnaire – A structured guide to capture insights, define requirements, and scope processes during workshops.

Together, these assets save valuable project time, enhance collaboration, and provide clear direction for configuration and planning after the workshops. Each document follows a consistent, guided structure — ensuring a professional and efficient experience for your teams.

So, what are you waiting for?

Explore the new SAP Sustainability Roadmaps today in the SAP Roadmap Viewer and see how they can accelerate your sustainability transformation.

entry.title: SAP Business One : Unit price initialization in a sales order item
entry.content:
I would need to initialize the unit price to zero in sales order item (only at creation and when the product code is specified) for a specific price list despite this price list have specified alternative price in in different currencies.

The standard set zero in the unit price on sales order item only if all the prices in price list are zero. If a price is specified this price is get and used in the sales order item.

In short it can be realized a sort of ABAP Process Before Output with SAP  Business One (SAP HANA ver.)?

If yes do you have any source code example that can helps?

Thanks a lot in advance for your collaboration and Help

Regards

Francesco

Now, weeks after the go-live we see that the system is not creating the accruals automatically. 

Any idea how to solve it or on what is missing?

Regards

 

Marcelo Morais

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay eligibility based on Absence/leave types...
entry.content:
Hi @tatiana_caraima 

I've never built this specific requirement in a standard varpay configuration where the rules would fully exclude the person from even getting a record retrieved from EC. However in customized varpay configs with Assignment Level Custom Fields I've done these kind of checks where you count within each record the number of days an employee has spent on a specific value (here event reason which should be equal to time type) then you do the check at the entry level and set final payout to 0.

What I can say to come back to your requirement  is that when I built the test case for this blog I struggled to get data from the Time Off Module in a consistent way (for example in case someone had overlapping entries or entries not yet approved), which is the reason for the first paragraph advocating for an additional custom field in Job Info with a business rule to copy the time off entry into it so we can reliably use that in our Main Record Eligibility Rule.

Hence if you've already spent a lot of time building this and can't make it work then I would suggest trying to build this through an MDF object with on Save rule (User ID to trigger the On Save for each user could be populated from Integration center so there is no csv upload needed). MDFs support Time Off module better and it would actually display the number of days for each user in that MDF so it would help the customer validate data too.

Hope these ideas will help trigger the spark to make this happen.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Import Tab in Purchase Order for Intercompany Stock Transfer with Cross-border Storage Location
entry.content:
Good day,

We are on SAP ECC 6.0.

We have a plant that is located in Germany with an issuing storage location in a different EU country. 

Whenever we do an STO (PO type UD) from that issuing storage location in the Netherlands to a storage location in Germany, we need to report Intrastat data and therefore we need the import data. The storage location in the Netherlands has an address assigned.

However, the import tab does not appear when we enter the Dutch issuing storage location on item level. This seems because the import-tab activation check is done one header level and it compares the company code country with the supplying plant country. If those are the same, then no import tab appears. 

SAP considers this cross-border STO not a cross-border STO, even though it is because of how the import-tab check works.

Via the path Materials Management -> Purchasing -> Foreign Trade/Customs -> Control Foreign Trade Data in MM and SD Documents ->Import screens in purchasing document we can make sure the import tab is always displayed, even when it is not required (goods moving from DE > DE).

Any possibilities to make the import tab appear when the country of the issuing storage location is not the same as the supplying plant country?

 

Thanks in advance.

 

Floyd

entry.title: Introducing Horizon Themes and Usability Enhancements in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
A Fresh Look and a Smoother Experience for All Users

We are excited to announce the introduction of the Horizon themes in SAP Analytics Cloud a modern, cohesive visual language aligned across SAP’s product suite. You will have access to Morning and Evening Horizon, the light and dark themes as well as to the high contrast white and black themes.

This release also brings a series of improvements to the side navigation, user profile, user settings, and the search, making it easier than ever to find insights and personalize your application.

 

Horizon Themes: Modern, Accessible, and Unified

The introduction of Horizon themes marks the next step in our user experience journey. These themes feature clean lines, contemporary color palettes, and improved contrasts, resulting in visually appealing UI that remain comfortable for extended work sessions. Accessibility is at the heart of Horizon, with thoughtful color selections and focus indicators for every user. The experience remains consistent as you move between SAP Analytics Cloud and other SAP solutions, offering a unified interface that supports productivity and ease of use. Personalize your experience by choosing from light, dark, and high contrast theme variants—simply head to your user settings to select your preferred look.

The Belize theme will remain the default in Q4 and continue to be available for the next few quarters. Looking ahead, Horizon will become the standard theme in the first half of 2026. If you’d like to enable Horizon for your organization sooner, simply navigate to the administration section under default appearance to set Horizon as your tenant’s default theme.

 

Improved User Profile and Settings

The user profile and settings have been reimagined to put key information and settings at your fingertips. Instantly access your account details, profile image, and settings in one clear and organized dialog. Additionally, the “About” section is now conveniently located within your user profile making key information more accessible whenever you need it.

 

Simplified and Adaptive Side Navigation

The redesigned side navigation bar logically organizes content and tools for easy access. Collapsible sections expand your workspace, and in collapsed view, hovering over each symbol shows module names to help you quickly find what you need.

 

More Convenient Search

The search now features autocomplete, making it noticeably more convenient and user-friendly. As you begin typing, relevant suggestions appear instantly, streamlining the process of finding models, stories, and files. This enhancement helps you locate what you need more efficiently, even if you can’t recall exact names, ensuring a smoother search experience.

These updates are based on user feedback and extensive research, reflecting SAP’s commitment to delivering an analytics platform that is powerful, accessible, and a pleasure to use. The Horizon themes and experience enhancements aim to reduce friction, promote creativity, and empower you to shape insights in a visually appealing and highly functional space.

 

What's Next

You can continue to style your SAP Analytics Cloud Stories independently, as the story theme mechanism will remain unchanged and won't follow the overall SAC theme.

With the Q1 2026 release, we plan to update the preferences for new stories and make the Horizon Morning theme available in every story; both Morning and Evening Horizon themes are currently available on GitHub.

The new Horizon themes and user experience improvements will be available mid-November in the Q4 2025 SAP Analytics Cloud release.

If you have feedback on the Horizon themes or the planned story theme updates, please reach out to me by message or in the comments.

entry.title: Retrieve the task list operations for a specific material, similar to what SAP transaction CA03?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I hope you’re doing well!
I’m trying to retrieve the task list operations for a specific material, similar to what SAP transaction CA03 displays.

Here’s what I’ve done so far: Joined tables like MAPL, PLKO, PLFL, PLAS, and PLPO. (I tried also without PLFL)

What I noticed is that CA03 seems to show sometimes operations for task list type “S”.

Any advice on whether my approach is correct or if I need to consider something else?
Thanks a lot for your help!

 

CODE:
SELECT plpo.VORNR,
plpo.STEUS,
plpo.ARBID,
plpo.WERKS,
plpo.LTXA1,
plpo.BMSCH,
plpo.VGE01, plpo.VGW01,
plpo.VGE02, plpo.VGW02,
plpo.VGE03, plpo.VGW03
FROM MAPL mapl
JOIN PLKO plko
ON mapl.PLNTY = plko.PLNTY
AND mapl.PLNNR = plko.PLNNR
AND mapl.PLNAL = plko.PLNAL
AND mapl.MANDT = plko.MANDT
AND plko.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLFL plfl
ON plko.PLNTY = plfl.PLNTY
AND plko.PLNNR = plfl.PLNNR
AND plko.PLNAL = plfl.PLNAL
AND plko.MANDT = plfl.MANDT
AND plfl.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLAS plas
ON plfl.PLNTY = plas.PLNTY
AND plfl.PLNNR = plas.PLNNR
AND plfl.PLNFL = plas.PLNFL
AND plfl.PLNAL = plas.PLNAL
AND plfl.MANDT = plas.MANDT
AND plas.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLPO plpo
ON plas.PLNTY = plpo.PLNTY
AND plas.PLNNR = plpo.PLNNR
AND plas.PLNKN = plpo.PLNKN
AND plas.MANDT = plpo.MANDT
WHERE mapl.MANDT = '100'
AND mapl.MATNR = '<MATERIAL_NUMBER>'
AND mapl.WERKS = '<PLANT_CODE>'
AND plko.DATUV <= CURRENT_DATE
AND mapl.PLNNR = '<ROUTING_NUMBER>'
AND mapl.PLNAL = '<ALTERNATIVE_NUMBER>'
ORDER BY plpo.VORNR;

entry.title: SAP IAS Implementation on an SAP ECC on premise and direct API endpoints.
entry.content:
Hello!

I have been working in the implementation of IAS for my SAP system. The goal is to protect UI5 applications with MFA. So far so good, when the user wants to log in, is redirected to the IAS login page, where MFA is enforced. After a successful logon the user is redirected back to the corresponding UI5 application.

As an example, let's assume I have a UI5 application where users go to create purchase orders, this works all fine as long as you do it the legit way, but if I wanted to instead of using the UI5 application just identify the API endpoint to create purchase orders and then hit that directly using postman for example, it would let me do it just fine as long as I put my user id and password in the request headers.

To me this kind of defeats the purpose of MFA, but I am not sure if this is by design or I am missing something. Has anyone been here before? Is there something additional I need to do to enforce MFA on API endpoints?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: Types of planning and number formats in Compensation : the case of Hourly employees
entry.content: @mariammahmoud Sorry I never replied to this.  Option 1 only retrieves whichever pay component on the profile of an employee is flagged as Use for Comp = Comp or both. The logic of who gets which paycomponent should be built in EC directly (if you're in Canada you'll get a CAD paycomponent with frequency = monthly but if you are in Germany you'll get EUR with Annual for example). Hope this helps.

entry.content:

Does anyone know what configuration step I might be missing? Or can anyone share insights into how the interaction setup works for tickets in this context?

entry.title: ChaRM 4 system landscape not importing to Pre-Prod
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are implementing a 4 system landscape with ChaRM, and we have activated the Preliminary Import functionality.  

Flow is this:  DEV--> QA-->PreProd--> Prod

My understanding is that with the preliminary import activated, the Change Document for a normal change is marked as "successfully tested" then the transport is released from the Dev system, imported into the QA system, and put in the buffer for the PreProd.  Based on the documentation, the task list should not have to be used as no Basis involvement is required with the preliminary import activated.

I'm referencing this documentation.

Preliminary Import of Normal Changes | SAP Help Portal

What is happening in my case, is that the QA transport --not the ToC--is being imported into QA only after I perform the step "approve preliminary import".  And for the PreProd import, that only is happening after "Tested for Production Import" step.  Neither of these makes sense, as you're approving it was tested in PreProd before it's even been imported--my understanding is that the transport is supposed to be imported, but left in the PreProd buffer until final approval.

Any assistance is greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Germany CSD Oct 28th – Joule for SAP Ariba & Fieldglass is here, get prepared to leverage it!
entry.content:
Joule SAP Copilot is now available for Spend Management, with initial skills released in Q3 and additional enhancements expected in Q4 and 2026*. Are you prepared to activate these new features?

Furthermore, SAP Ariba and Fieldglass solutions include embedded AI capabilities that can be enabled now.

If you are attending Oct 28th Customer Success Day – Spend Management in Garching I invite you to join the “Joule & AI: Configuration & Prerequisites” workshop at 15:30 to gain a comprehensive overview of Joule enablement steps.

I will also be present throughout the full day event and available to discuss further during networking breaks.

In the meantime, please review the following informative blogs on this topic:

  • Unlocking the Potential of SAP AI in Procurement
  • Joule in SAP Ariba Applications
  • Configure Single-Sign-On for SAP Ariba with SAP Cloud Identity Services

Why to Attend This Session?

  • Stay Ahead of the Curve: Get the first look at Joule—the new SAP AI Copilot—and its skills for SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Unified Experience Across SAP Solutions: Learn how Cloud Identity Services streamline authentication for your users, delivering a secure and harmonious login experience.
  • Unlock Embedded AI: See how AI capabilities are already working behind the scenes in SAP Ariba Category Management, Guided Sourcing, Guided Buying, and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Direct Access to Experts: Register for Customer Drop-in Sessions to dive deeper, ask questions, and get personalized support for your journey.

Who Should Attend?
If you are a procurement professional, IT leader, business analyst, or simply passionate about digital transformation, this session will bring you fresh insights and hands-on guidance. Come with your questions and your curiosity.

Let’s unlock what’s possible with AI for SAP Ariba and Fieldglass—see you in Garching!

*Legal Disclaimer: The information in this document is not a commitment, promise, or legal obligation to deliver any material, code, or functionality. This document is provided without a warranty of any kind… Read more

entry.title: Re: 🟢 Exploring the Path to SAP Certification

entry.title: Part 2: Architecting SaaS Resilience Against S/4HANA Variance
entry.content:
Part 1: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/building-saas-products-on-sap-btp/ba-p/14231929 

The hidden complexity: landscape variance in S/4HANA

If you are building a multitenant Software as a Service (SaaS) application on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), you face one primary, often unspoken challenge: Landscape Variance.

When connecting to a customer's S/4HANA system, you cannot assume a standardized business process configuration. One customer might use Purchase Requisitions; another might bypass them entirely. A third might have a legacy system feeding Purchase Orders (POs) via EDI. Your core SaaS architecture, built on rigid assumptions about S/4HANA objects, immediately breaks down.

The Clean Core strategy is our defense against this chaos. It's not just about keeping S/4HANA standard; it’s about architecting a resilient, multitenant application that survives the reality of heterogeneous customer landscapes.

The two-system solution: CAP as the translation layer

The solution is to tightly separate concerns, positioning the Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) as the mission-critical translation layer between your standard SaaS logic and the customer’s unique S/4HANA core.

S/4HANA: the unknown system of record

This system is the source of truth, but it’s inherently variable. Our golden rule: The SaaS product must only interact with versioned APIs exposed by S/4HANA, never raw objects. The core system’s internal processes remain irrelevant to the application logic as long as the API contract is met.

BTP - CAP: the resilient service layer

CAP provides the necessary framework for multitenancy, data normalization, and extension handling. This is where we implement the Clean Core strategy.

The CAP Service Layer,  acts as the common data model for your application. We rely on three core CAP capabilities to manage landscape variance:

  • Normalization: Custom handlers are implemented to take the messy, variant data from the S/4HANA API and map it into the unified CDS entities that your SaaS front-end and business logic consume.

  • Multitenancy and Isolation: CAP automatically handles the creation and management of isolated database containers (in SAP HANA Cloud) for each tenant, ensuring complete data segregation.

  • Extension Model: This is where CAP truly shines in solving the variance problem, particularly for custom fields and extensions (Trigger 2 below).

CAP solves the three triggers for BTP logic

The moment you encounter a potential difference in a customer’s landscape, that logic must be placed in BTP, within the CAP layer.

Trigger 1: core process variations (process normalization)

The Problem: Customer A uses Purchase Requisitions, Customer B uses Direct POs. Your SaaS app needs a single ProcurementDocument entity.

The CAP Solution: We use custom service handlers within CAP to implement a Process Normalization Layer.

  • The CAP service intercepts the request for ProcurementDocument.

  • A tenant-specific check determines the appropriate S/4HANA API flow (e.g., calling the Requisitions API for Tenant A, or the PO API for Tenant B).

  • The handler then maps the resulting S/4 data structure into the unified SaaS.ProcurementDocument CDS entity, hiding the underlying process variance from the consumer.

Trigger 2: custom field and extension variations (the CDS extension mechanism)

The Problem: Your base model assumes fields X, Y, Z on a Purchase Order. Customer A added custom field industryClassification, and Customer B needs custom field legacyID.

The CAP Solution: We leverage the CAP Multitenancy and the CDS Extension Mechanism.

Your base CAP service model (CDS) remains non-modified (Core Model Protection). When Customer A is onboarded, an extension CDS file is deployed only to their tenant container.

  • Example CDS Extension:

    extend entity SaaS.PurchaseOrder with {
    industryClassification : String(50);
};

  • Result: The new field is automatically merged into the database schema and OData/REST service endpoint only for Tenant A. The core application logic and data model remain intact, allowing for graceful, tenant-specific schema variance without core code changes.

Trigger 3: process change detection (runtime adaptation)

The Problem: A customer changes their S/4HANA configuration (e.g., disabling a process or upgrading).

The CAP possible solution: Build runtime adaptation logic into your service handlers. This involves:

  • Periodically scanning the S/4HANA landscape metadata for changes (APIs available, field availability).

  • Using this metadata in the CAP handlers to adjust runtime logic dynamically (e.g., if API A is disabled, automatically route the query to the fallback logic using API B).

  • CAP's contract stability ensures that while the integration logic changes internally, the external SaaS API remains stable.

Critical considerations for CAP deployment

While CAP provides the technical solution, architects must recognize the operational and cost implications of this strategy. This architectural decision carries hidden costs and effort that must be budgeted correctly:

  • Landscape Discovery: This is not a one-time setup. You must budget 1–N weeks of specialized S/4HANA expert time per customer to interpret their configuration and guide the necessary CAP adapter development.

  • Normalization Cost: The development of the mapping engine and custom service handlers in CAP requires significant upfront time and continued maintenance. This layer is the work that truly delivers resilience, and it must be prioritized. (Can be classified as Customer cost - if You need extensions You can do it on Your own).

  • Onboarding Timeline: Be honest with stakeholders—your onboarding timeline will be 6–8 weeks, not 2, due to the mandatory discovery and adapter build phase.

The Clean Core approach, implemented through the robust multitenancy and extension capabilities of SAP CAP, is the only sustainable strategy for building SaaS in the variance-rich SAP ecosystem.

I am currently working on a comprehensive SaaS template built on CAP and BTP, designed to automate much of this landscape discovery and normalization process, providing a robust, pre-configured foundation for partners and developers building solutions in the SAP ecosystem.

Stay Tuned!

entry.title: Unexpected E-Verify Outages, October 20, 2025
entry.content:
SAP / SuccessFactors has observed an intermittent outage of the DHS / E-Verify service. There are currently technical issues impacting the E-Verify service at this time. This appears to have begun on Monday, October 20th, 2025 and is occurring intermittently for all E-Verify customers.

There's also been a post from the DHS/E-Verify team regarding this outage: https://www.e-verify.gov/about-e-verify/whats-new/e-verify-is-experiencing-partial-system-outages-during-case-creation-0

The error may appear as a long loading time while executing any E-Verify related actions, such as opening, acting on, or closing E-Verify Cases. It may also register as an error in Onboarding saying:

Unable to retrieve data at this time.
Unable to access/contact DHS or
Unable to contact E-Verify service.

SAP / SuccessFactors Onboarding Support team remains in contact with the DHS / E-Verify team. We will provide updates as they come to us. This

You may always resubmit an E-Verify activity with a Delay Submission Reason of "Technical Issues" for all delayed E-Verify activities.

entry.title: Create User Group to Hide FlexSearch in HAC
entry.content:
Hi there, we are looking for ways that new access group to HAC can be created who would have access to everything except for FlexSearch.  Can you please let me know if there is an existing user group we can assign users or if there is a way we can create a custom group?  Thanks!


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Create User Group to Hide FlexSearch in HAC
entry.content:
Hello Chloe,

You can configure which areas of the SAP Commerce Cloud Administration Console are accessible to specific users. Based on assigned roles, users can or cannot access certain Administration Console tabs or perform specific actions. The Console offers multiple predefined roles for immediate use, and you can also create custom roles using the Spring Security framework to meet your specific requirements.

The Administration Console allows you to extend it with custom functionalities and tabs. Without implementing specific role configurations, Spring Security will not impose restrictions by default, allowing any user access to new tabs and actions. The following documentation provides insight on creating a new role and assigning it to users for exclusive tab access:

  • Securing Administration Console Using Roles

Please review the documentation and feel free to contact if you have further questions or need additional assistance.

Best regards,
Barbara
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Missing standard value in a c...
entry.content:
Hello @LukasKuhn 

Yes. The business catalogue that controls that Default Values section Ledger, Ledger Group, Calculate Tax, Segment, etc. In the User Settings app IAM Information System is SAP_CA_BC_USER_PARAM_PC – User Default Parameters (General).

Why you saw it with all SAP default roles many finance default roles include this catalogue directly or as a dependency, so the section appears.

Quick verify in your tenant

Open IAM Information System → check Assigned Business Catalogue.

 

In Maintain Business Roles, add SAP_CA_BC_USER_PARAM_PC to your role → assign to the user → re-login → the Default Values section should be there.

 

If you find it difficult send me your IAM screenshot.

With king regards

Chuma

entry.title: SmartTable not displaying value text (Text Association) in SAPUI5 app embedded in MyInbox
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I’m fairly new to SAPUI5 development, so please excuse me if my explanation isn’t perfectly professional yet 🙂

I’m currently working on a freestyle SAPUI5 app that is embedded into MyInbox. In MyInbox, users can handle various tasks — including invoice processing tasks.

My app is displayed for those invoice tasks and shows detailed invoice data.

 

What I’m trying to do

The app first shows invoice header data, and below that, it displays different SmartTables for navigation entities such as GLAccountItems, PurchaseOrderItems, etc.

One example SmartTable looks like this:

This works fine — except for one detail:

When I show a field like CostCenter in a SmartField, I get something like this: 1234 (Development General)

But in the SmartTable, I only see: 1234

So the text description (value text) is missing in the table.

 

I’ve learned that this topic is related to Text Associations in SAPUI5 / OData.

 

 

What I found in the metadata

The metadata for the CostCenter field contains a ValueList annotation, which defines its F4 help and seems to refer to a value list entity (VL_SH_FAC_COST_CENTER😞

Picture 1

The referenced value list entity looks like this (simplified for readability):

Picture 2

From what I understand, sap:text="KTEXT" defines the link between the key (KOSTL) and its text. So I assume this is where the “Development General” text comes from when using a SmartField.

 

 

Additional metadata section (possibly related)

There’s also another annotation on the same property that I don’t fully understand:

Picture 3

Does this Common.v1.Text annotation link the CostCenter key to its text value internally? And if yes — why does it work in a SmartField but not inside a SmartTable column?

 

 

What I’ve heard

Apparently, it might be possible to override or extend metadata annotations using a custom annotation file (for example, adding or redefining the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text term).

Would this be a valid approach to make the SmartTable also display the text value (e.g., 1234 (Development General)) instead of only the key?

 

 

My question

How can I make my SmartTable display both the key and the text (using the Text Association) for fields like CostCenter — just like SmartField does?

If a custom annotation file is the right way, how exactly should it look like?

If you need additional metadata snippets, project settings, or controller code to help analyze this, I’m happy to share more details.

 

Thanks so much in advance for any help or best practices you can provide!

I recently prepared for and passed the SAP C_TS4FI_2023 exam, and I highly recommend checking out Certs4Future for your preparation. Their updated and well-structured practice questions were incredibly close to the actual exam format, which helped me understand key concepts and manage time effectively.

Along with Certs4Future, I also reviewed the official SAP Learning Hub materials to strengthen my understanding of core financial accounting processes.

entry.title: Re: invocing Date Updation in Sales Order - Billing Docum...
entry.content:
Hello @GAK1 

Thank you for your follow up and clarifying. Updating the customer master invoicing calendar won't retroactively change existing sales orders. For orders already in the system, you have two options:

Mass changes the Billing Date on open sales orders
Use Mass Change of Sales Documents and choose the Billing Date field at Sales Order Header. Run it as a background job on your order selection.

 

SAP Help Portal-Mass Change of Sales Documents

Set the billing date at billing creation, recommended for delivery-related billing
In Create Billing Documents (F0798), Set the date at creation time. If you need it to match the creation date, use the KBA’s copy-control or BAdI approach; also, be aware of the setting that can override BAdI with a manually entered value date. SAP Support Portal-KBA-2892513 - How to set billing date equal to billing creation date via copy control - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In summary, apply Mass Change for the Billing Date header on order-related invoices; otherwise, set the date at billing creation  or use KBA 2892513 so the billing date adheres to your new calendar rule.

Kind regards,
Chuma

Useful SAP Documentation

  • Mass Change of Sales Documents supports Billing Date at SO header. SAP Help Portal-Mass Change of Sales Documents
  • Perform Mass Change of Sales Orders shows Change Billing Date at header. SAP Help Portal-Mass Change of Sales Documents
  • KBA 2892513 – Set billing date equal billing creation date via copy control BAdI. SAP Support Portal-KBA-2892513 - How to set billing date equal to billing creation date via copy control - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • KBA 3539425 – Manual date in F0798 overrides BAdI; how to avoid. SAP Support Portal-KBA-3539425 - The date input in the "Create Billing Documents" app is taken although with billing date set in BAdI SD_BIL_DATA_TRANSFER

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Migration Cockpit Material BOM Item ID control field ITM_IDENT_EXT issue
entry.content:
Experts, need help with S4 Hana 2023/08 Migration Cockpit (MC) loading the Material BOM.  In the download Template there is a field on the BOM Item called "Item ID".  This is a mandatory field, but we want the system to generate the Item ID number and not have to enter in one for every BOM item we have.

From the information on the internet, the control field ITM_IDENT_EXT field needs to contain a 'X' for the system to generate this field during conversion.  It is supposed to be located on the MC Template for the Material BOM in the BOM Item section.  But this field does not exist.

We reviewed the information for the MC Project in the LTMOM transaction and could not find this ITM_IDENT_EXT field anywhere.  If we try to leave the "Item ID" field on the template blank, we get an error during the MC Upload.

Does anyone know where this ITM_IDENT_EXT field exist or how to force  the MC to automatically generate the "Item ID" field during conversion?

Any help would be appreciated.

entry.title: Re: How to send POs in S/4HANA Public Cloud to custom par...
entry.content:
Good day @Ankit2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following reference for more details.

How to configure output parameter determination for purchase contracts?

In summary, output determination for purchase Orders in public cloud only fills the Country/Region and Language fields automatically when the email recipient partner role has complete communication data in the BP master.

In regard to custom partner functions representing contact persons, these attributes often remain blank because OPD cannot derive them from the relationship unless:

  • Ther relationship category is BUR001 (Contact Person)
  • The Contact’s BP has language and country maintained at header level, and
  • The email is set as Standard Email Address

The below screenshots offers an option on how to complete BP Master Data for Contact Person. 

  • Search for the App on the screen.

Search for the Contact Person BP linked through Z4

Under:

  • General data --> Adress: Ensure Country/Region and language are filled.
  • Communication: Ensure Email address is filled and marked as Standard.
  • Save, then refresh the PO. The output should now populate Country/Language automatically.

If after you verify that those setting are correct and still no output triggers, implement BAdI MM_PUR_S4H_OUTPUT_EMAIL_RECIPIENTS to fetch the Z4 partner’s email, language, and country manually. This will ensure that your PO output record is complete and triggers succefully with the Z4 recipient.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Clarification on MRP Behaviour for Split Procurement...
entry.content:
Good day @Vindhya 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following references for more details.

Special Procurement Keys, Special procurement types - effects in MRP

https://help.sap.com/doc/6afeeafa6a424b9b8060d91da975c497/2025.1/en-US/CPP-EN.pdf

Cross-Plant Planning

In public cloud edition, MRP in the receiving plant does not check the real-time stock of the supply plant during planning.

When a Special Procurement Key is assigned, MRP in Plant A will always create an STO for the full requirement quantity, regardless of plant B’s stock.

The supplying plant’s own MRP run then plans how to fulfil that STO through stock or external procurement.

Therefore, your split procurement scenario that included the automatic creation of both an STO and an external PR for the same requirement within a simple MRP is not supported in standard public cloud.

However, you can achieve the desired behaviour by:

  • Using Quota Arrangement (standard split sourcing), or
  • Handle replenishment in the supplying plant’s MRP cycle.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to use Time Recording Calendar for submitting Time Sheets in future
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
We have a problem at a client where we are implementing Employee Central Time Tracking.  It has to do with Time Recording Periods and Payroll Processing, in conjunction with a requirement to submit time sheets in the future.

The Time Recording Approval Period was initially set up for weekly time sheets.  At the beginning of each week, (on system calendar date) EC creates a new time sheet where data is populated for negative employees.  Once that time sheet is approved, the results are replicated via PTP into infotype 2010 from where it can be picked up by the payroll run.
 
Problem comes with a payroll area that is paid up-to-date.  For that group of people, the time data needs to be made available in advance, as they need a lot of time to complete their payroll process.
 
We started off with Time Recording Submission Configuration to deviate the submission date, but that only provided us 2 additional days in advance.  Next step was to rather use a Time Recording Calendar to do early submission and approval of the time sheet.  For the initial setup this got us to 7-days prior to the pay period close.  However, the client then indicated that they need to start calculation runs within payroll more than a week ahead of time, as it sometimes takes 14-days to get the regular pay run checked and complete.
 
The only way we could identify to do this, was to switch to a bi-weekly time-sheet period that match the pay period and then use a Time Recording Calendar that submits and approves on the first day of the period.  If we go that route, the time sheet can be, submitted and approved up to 14 days ahead of the pay period close.

However, the Generate Time Sheet job,  can only generate the attendances for each calendar day, on the current date.  This implies that for a time sheet generated 14 days ahead, there will be a at least 13 "empty days", I believe we can get past this by a time valuation rule that writes the planned time to the Time Type Group that is normally used for Regular time, if the day is in the future.

However, it was then determined that there are at least once a year in December ( and some years also in June) where they need more advance time, as much as 19 or 21 days prior to the pay period end.

Here is an example of the latter part of the year, the dates flagged in red are the problem:

We tried to set up a one-week period followed by a three week period, on year end, in the calendar. The time sheet was still on a two week time recording approval period, as such it does partially overlap the period specified in the calendar.  It did allow us to save the config, without raising an error, but when repeating the setup on an earlier date (to test on current calendar date) it did not seem to work, although the TLMTriggerTasks job did run. 


Thus far, we could not identify a way to create and approve these time sheets prior to the calendar date that the pay period starts on.  Do you or some of your clients have similar problems?  Any ideas on how to make this work will be most welcome.

Thanks and have a great day,
Albert

Thanks

entry.title: Re: how to show up payment methods that we need , like ca...
entry.content:
Hello @0uTY,

Your observation is correct. In SAP S/4HANA public cloud, the payment methods shown in CBC depend on the configuration for your country, region, and company code. Yes, you can add additional A/P payment methods, such as Cheque.

To add payment methods such as Cheque

Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region -define the method and mark it for outgoing

Set Up Payment Methods per Company Code -allow it for the paying company code, limits, forms

Set Up Bank Determination for Payment Transactions -assign to house bank/bank account. SAP Support Portal-KBA-3457437 - How to define payment method in SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition

  • Cash is not an automatic payment option because it is handled outside the payment run. Instead, use the app, like Post Cash Journal Entries, to record cash receipts payments. SAP Help Portal-Post Cash Journal Entries
  • You see only three methods in CBC because of your current country or region and company code settings. You can add more, like Cheque, through 'Set Up Payment Methods' and link them in 'Set Up Bank Determination for Payment Transactions.SAP Help Portal-Configuring Payment Methods

If your system is localised for Japan, those three options you see, Domestic transfer, Foreign transfer, Electronic Monetary Claim are standard examples. You can still add Cheque using the steps above, but Cash will stay as Cash Journal.SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Electronic Monetary Claim ID for Supplier

Let me know if it helps,

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Output multiple instructions all at once (download mu...
entry.content:
Hello @ZZ3987,

Thank you for your question, please note, there is no Tcode on S4HANA Public cloud,the Tocdes are replaced by Fiori App

Standard involves mass printing per order via release/mass processing and Output Management with merge functions within a single order’s PDF. For one combined file across multiple orders, an extension or integration is usually needed.

Check below SAP Useful documentations

Mass/background printing in Public Cloud occurs automatically at order release and via processing, typically per order.  SAP Learning-Describing the Printing of Shop Floor Papers

Mass processing apps: You can mass-release/print through the Mass Processing of Process and Production Orders app.

Output Management governs routing (queue/email): Public Cloud uses Output Control/Output Management to send each document to a print queue or email. This framework is standard. Configuring SAP S/4HANA Output  and  ControlOutput Management   and SAP Learning-Introducing Output Management 

Merge attachments within one order are standard: You can merge selected attachments with the form for a given output use Merge with Form Template in the attachment dialog. This applies to the output you are generating.  SAP Help Portal-Adding Attachments

One big multi-PDF for many orders is not a standard feature: SAP docs show outputs are generated per business object/order; there is no delivered combine many orders into one PDF button. Customers who need that use side-by-side automation or third-party output solutions. (Example vendor shown for context. SAP Help Portal-Output Management for Manufacturing Orders

Standard involves mass printing per order via release and mass processing and Output Management with merge functions within a single order’s PDF. For one combined file across multiple orders, an extension or integration is usually needed.

With kind regards

Chuma
